properties.name: driveId
properties.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

properties.name: folderId
properties.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

properties.name: documentURL
properties.description: The ID in the document URL (or just paste the whole URL)

properties.name: simple
properties.description: Whether to return a simplified version of the response instead of the raw data

properties.name: actionsUi

values.description: The update action

values.name: insertSegment
values.description: The location where to create the object

values.name: segmentId
values.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote. The Document → Get operation lists all segment IDs (make sure you disable the simple toggle).

values.name: index
values.description: The zero-based index, relative to the beginning of the specified segment

values.name: name
values.description: The name of the Named Range. Names do not need to be unique.

values.name: startIndex
values.description: The zero-based start index of this range

values.name: endIndex
values.description: The zero-based end index of this range

values.name: bulletPreset
values.description: A bulleted list with a DISC, CIRCLE and SQUARE bullet glyph for the first 3 list nesting levels

options.name: Bullet List
options.description: A bulleted list with a DISC, CIRCLE and SQUARE bullet glyph for the first 3 list nesting levels

options.name: Checkbox List
options.description: A bulleted list with CHECKBOX bullet glyphs for all list nesting levels

options.name: Numbered List
options.description: A numbered list with DECIMAL numeric glyphs separated by periods, where each nesting level uses the previous nesting level's glyph as a prefix. For example: 1., 1.1., 2., 2.2 .

values.name: footerId
values.description: The ID of the footer to delete. To retrieve it, use the get document where you can find under footers attribute.

values.name: headerId
values.description: The ID of the header to delete. To retrieve it, use the get document where you can find under headers attribute.

values.name: namedRangeReference
values.description: The value determines which range or ranges to delete

values.name: value
values.description: The ID of the range

values.name: value
values.description: The name of the range

values.name: objectId
values.description: The ID of the positioned object to delete (An object that is tied to a paragraph and positioned relative to its beginning), See the Google documentation

values.name: insertSegment
values.description: The location where to create the object

values.name: segmentId
values.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote. The Document → Get operation lists all segment IDs (make sure you disable the simple toggle).

values.description: Inserts the text at the end of a header, footer, footnote, or document body

properties.name: updateFields
properties.description: Apply changes to the latest revision. Otherwise changes will not be processed.

values.name: control
values.description: Apply changes to the latest revision. Otherwise changes will not be processed.

options.name: Target
options.description: Apply changes to the latest revision. Otherwise changes will not be processed.

options.name: Required
options.description: Apply changes to the provided revision while incorporating other collaborators' changes. This mode is used for the recent revision, Otherwise changes will not be processed.

values.name: control
values.description: Apply changes to the latest revision. Otherwise changes will not be processed.

options.name: Target
options.description: Apply changes to the latest revision. Otherwise changes will not be processed.

options.name: Required
options.description: Apply changes to the provided revision while incorporating other collaborators' changes. This mode is used for the recent revision, Otherwise changes will not be processed.

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
